qas.question: The design of USB is asymmetrical in what?
How many devices may be connected to a host controller?
What HUB is built into the host controller?
The design of the USB is asymmetrical in its what?
How many devices can be connected to a host controller?
What hub is built into the host controller?
A USB host may implement how many host controllers?
How many USB ports may a host controller provide?

context: The design architecture of USB is asymmetrical in <a0_0>its <a4_0>topology<a4_0/><a0_0/>, consisting of a host, a multitude of downstream USB ports, and multiple peripheral devices connected in a tiered-star topology. Additional USB hubs may be included in the tiers, allowing branching into a tree structure with up to five tier levels. A USB host may implement <a7_0>multiple<a7_0/> host controllers and each host controller may provide <a8_0>one or more USB ports<a8_0/>. <a5_0>Up to <a1_0>127 devices<a5_0/><a1_0/>, including hub devices if present, may be connected to a single host controller. USB devices are linked <a2_0>in series through hubs<a2_0/>. One hub—built into the host controller—is <a3_0><a6_0>the root hub<a6_0/><a3_0/>.
